criterion: Reward for accurately documenting all major patient-reported information about mesalamine adherence difficulties and symptom fluctuation (forgetting doses, busy schedule, improved symptoms with regular use, worsening with missed doses).

Reward for accurately documenting all clinician responses and recommendations (acknowledging difficulty, suggesting phone reminders and pill organizer, stressing consistency, instructing to report new symptoms/side effects).
Reward for correctly importing relevant chart details that were implicitly or explicitly referenced (mesalamine 2.4 g daily for Crohn's disease, patient age/sex) without adding unrelated chart data.
Reward for maintaining precise wording for critical data elements (medication name, dosage, key instructions) while appropriately summarizing less critical dialogue.
Penalize for omission of any major conversational element or pertinent chart detail, resulting in an overall incomplete note relative to the transcript.
Penalize for inclusion of information not supported by transcript or chart (e.g., new diagnoses, vitals, lab orders, medication changes, physical exam findings).
Penalize for inaccurate or selective copying from the chart, such as wrong medication dose, adding unrelated family history, or including conditions not mentioned during the encounter.
Penalize for misrepresentation or distortion of statements (e.g., implying perfect adherence, incorrect attribution of speech, altering timeline or emphasis).
